mechanics.condition: Trap exists within range AND Trap is within line of sight AND Trap meets the spell's definition
mechanics.outcome: Caster senses the presence of the trap

mechanics.trigger: When determining if an object is a 'trap' for this spell
mechanics.condition: Object would inflict a sudden or unexpected harmful or undesirable effect AND Object was specifically intended as such by its creator
mechanics.outcome: Object qualifies as a 'trap' for this spell (e.g., alarm spell, glyph of warding, mechanical pit trap)

mechanics.trigger: When determining if an object is a 'trap' for this spell
mechanics.condition: Object is a natural hazard (e.g., natural weakness in floor, unstable ceiling, hidden sinkhole) OR Object was NOT specifically intended as a trap by its creator
mechanics.outcome: Object does NOT qualify as a 'trap' for this spell

mechanics.condition: Trap is sensed by this spell
mechanics.outcome: Caster learns the general nature of the danger posed by the trap, but NOT the specific location of each trap

description_text: You sense the presence of any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap, for the purpose of this spell, includes anything that would inflict a sudden or unexpected effect you consider harmful or undesirable, which was specifically intended as such by its creator. Thus, the spell would sense an area affected by the alarm spell, a glyph of warding, or a mechanical pit trap, but it would not reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole. This spell merely reveals that a trap is present. You don't learn the location of each trap, but you do learn the general nature of the danger posed by a trap you sense.
